TABLE.NAME: workshop
TABLE.COMMENT: This table keeps information about the module instances and their settings

FIELD.NAME: course
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of the parent course

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Name of the activity

FIELD.NAME: intro
FIELD.COMMENT: The introduction or description of the activity

FIELD.NAME: introformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of the intro field

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The timestamp when the module was modified

FIELD.NAME: phase
FIELD.COMMENT: The current phase of workshop (0 = not available, 1 = submission, 2 = assessment, 3 = closed)

FIELD.NAME: useexamples
FIELD.COMMENT: optional feature: students practise evaluating on example submissions from teacher

FIELD.NAME: usepeerassessment
FIELD.COMMENT: optional feature: students perform peer assessment of others' work

FIELD.NAME: useselfassessment
FIELD.COMMENT: optional feature: students perform self assessment of their own work

FIELD.NAME: grade
FIELD.COMMENT: The maximum grade for submission

FIELD.NAME: gradinggrade
FIELD.COMMENT: The maximum grade for assessment

FIELD.NAME: strategy
FIELD.COMMENT: The type of the current grading strategy used in this workshop

FIELD.NAME: nattachments
FIELD.COMMENT: Number of required submission attachments

FIELD.NAME: latesubmissions
FIELD.COMMENT: Allow submitting the work after the deadline

FIELD.NAME: maxbytes
FIELD.COMMENT: Maximum size of the one attached file

FIELD.NAME: nexassessments
FIELD.COMMENT: If useexamples == 1: the number of required assessments of teacher examples (0 = all, greater than 0: the number)

FIELD.NAME: examplesmode
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 = example assessments are voluntary, 1 = examples must be assessed before submission, 2 = examples are available after own submission and must be assessed before peer/self assessment phase

FIELD.NAME: teacherweight
FIELD.COMMENT: The weight of the teacher's assessments

FIELD.NAME: agreeassessments
FIELD.COMMENT: Boolean - determines if author may comment assessments and agree/disagree with it

FIELD.NAME: assessmentcomps
FIELD.COMMENT: Comparison of assessments = required level of assessment similarity (0 = very lax, 1 = lax, 2 = fair, 3 = strict, 4 = very strict)

FIELD.NAME: submissionstart
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 = will be started manually, greater than 0 the timestamp of the start of the submission phase

FIELD.NAME: submissionend
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 = will be closed manually, greater than 0 the timestamp of the end of the submission phase

FIELD.NAME: assessmentstart
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 = will be started manually, greater than 0 the timestamp of the start of the assessment phase

FIELD.NAME: assessmentend
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 = will be closed manually, greater than 0 the timestamp of the end of the assessment phase

FIELD.NAME: releasegrades
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 = will be released manually, greater than 0 the timestamp when final grades are published

FIELD.NAME: password
FIELD.COMMENT: The access password

TABLE.NAME: workshop_submissions
TABLE.COMMENT: Info about the submission and the aggregation of the grade for submission, grade for assessment and final grade. Both grade for submission and grade for assessment can be overridden by teacher. Final grade is always the sum of them. All grades are stored as of 0-100.

FIELD.NAME: workshopid
FIELD.COMMENT: the id of the workshop instance

FIELD.NAME: example
FIELD.COMMENT: Is this submission an example from teacher

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: The author of the submission

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: Timestamp when the work was submitted for the first time

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: Timestamp when the submission has been updated

FIELD.NAME: title
FIELD.COMMENT: The submission title

FIELD.NAME: content
FIELD.COMMENT: Submission text

FIELD.NAME: contentformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of submission text

FIELD.NAME: contenttrust
FIELD.COMMENT: The trust mode of the data

FIELD.NAME: attachment
FIELD.COMMENT: Used by File API file_postupdate_standard_filemanager

FIELD.NAME: grade
FIELD.COMMENT: Grade for the submission calculated as average of the peer-assessments. The grade is a number from interval 0..100. If NULL then the grade for submission has not been aggregated yet.

FIELD.NAME: gradeover
FIELD.COMMENT: Grade for the submission manually overridden by a teacher. Grade is always from interval 0..100. If NULL then the grade is not overriden.

FIELD.NAME: gradeoverby
FIELD.COMMENT: The id of the user who has overridden the grade for submission.

FIELD.NAME: gradinggrade
FIELD.COMMENT: Grade for the assessment calculated by the module. The grade is a number from interval 0..100. If NULL then the grade for assessment has not been aggregated yet.

FIELD.NAME: teachercomment
FIELD.COMMENT: Teacher comment for the submission, for example describing the reasons for the overriding

FIELD.NAME: teachercommentformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of the teachercomment field

TABLE.NAME: workshop_assessments
TABLE.COMMENT: Info about the made assessment and automatically calculated grade for it. The proposed grade can be overridden by teacher.

FIELD.NAME: submissionid
FIELD.COMMENT: The id of the assessed submission

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: The id of the reviewer who created this assessment

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: If 0 then the assessment was allocated but the reviewer has not assessed yet. If greater than 0 then the timestamp of when the reviewer assessed for the first time

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: If 0 then the assessment was allocated but the reviewer has not assessed yet. If greater than 0 then the timestamp of when the reviewer assessed for the last time

FIELD.NAME: timeagreed
FIELD.COMMENT: If 0 then the assessment was not agreed by the author. If greater than 0 then the timestamp of when the assessment was agreed by the author

FIELD.NAME: grade
FIELD.COMMENT: The aggregated grade for submission suggested by the reviewer. The grade is computed from the values assigned to the assessment dimensions fields. If NULL then it has not been aggregated yet.

FIELD.NAME: gradinggrade
FIELD.COMMENT: The computed grade for this assessment. If NULL then it has not been computed yet.

FIELD.NAME: gradinggradeover
FIELD.COMMENT: Grade for the assessment manually overridden by a teacher. Grade is always from interval 0..100. If NULL then the grade is not overriden.

FIELD.NAME: gradinggradeoverby
FIELD.COMMENT: The id of the user who has overridden the grade for submission.

FIELD.NAME: generalcomment
FIELD.COMMENT: Comment from the reviewer

FIELD.NAME: generalcommentformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of generalcomment field

FIELD.NAME: teachercomment
FIELD.COMMENT: The comment from the teacher. For example the reason why the grade for assessment was overridden

FIELD.NAME: teachercommentformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of teachercomment field

TABLE.NAME: workshop_grades
TABLE.COMMENT: How the reviewers filled-up the grading forms, given grades and comments

FIELD.NAME: assessmentid
FIELD.COMMENT: Part of which assessment this grade is of

FIELD.NAME: dimensionid
FIELD.COMMENT: Foreign key. References dimension id in one of the grading strategy tables.

FIELD.NAME: grade
FIELD.COMMENT: Given grade in the referenced assessment dimension.

FIELD.NAME: peercomment
FIELD.COMMENT: Reviewer's comment to the grade value.

FIELD.NAME: peercommentformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of peercomment field

TABLE.NAME: workshop_forms
TABLE.COMMENT: Meta table to provide unique id for every assessment dimension which is needed for file api support.

FIELD.NAME: workshopid
FIELD.COMMENT: Workshop ID

FIELD.NAME: sort
FIELD.COMMENT: Defines the dimension order within the assessment form

FIELD.NAME: strategy
FIELD.COMMENT: Defines the target assessment form table

FIELD.NAME: localid
FIELD.COMMENT: The foreign primary key of one of the assessment forms tables.

TABLE.NAME: workshop_forms_accumulative
TABLE.COMMENT: The assessment dimensions definitions of Accumulative grading strategy forms

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: The description of the dimension

FIELD.NAME: descriptionformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of the description field

FIELD.NAME: grade
FIELD.COMMENT: If greater than 0, then the value is maximum grade on a scale 0..grade. If lesser than 0, then its absolute value is the id of a record in scale table. If equals 0, then no grading is possible for this dimension, just commenting.

FIELD.NAME: weight
FIELD.COMMENT: The weigh of the dimension

TABLE.NAME: workshop_forms_nograding
TABLE.COMMENT: The assessment dimensions definitions of No grading strategy forms

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: The description of the dimension

FIELD.NAME: descriptionformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of the description field

TABLE.NAME: workshop_forms_noerrors
TABLE.COMMENT: The assessment dimensions definitions of Number of errors grading strategy forms

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: The description of the dimension

FIELD.NAME: descriptionformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of the description field

FIELD.NAME: grade0
FIELD.COMMENT: The word describing the negative evaluation (like Poor, Missing, Absent, etc.). If NULL, it defaults to a translated string False

FIELD.NAME: grade1
FIELD.COMMENT: A word for possitive evaluation (like Good, Present, OK etc). If NULL, it defaults to a translated string True

FIELD.NAME: weight
FIELD.COMMENT: Weight of this dimension

TABLE.NAME: workshop_forms_noerrors_map
TABLE.COMMENT: This maps the number of errors to a percentual grade for submission

FIELD.NAME: workshopid
FIELD.COMMENT: The id of the workshop

FIELD.NAME: nonegative
FIELD.COMMENT: Number of negative responses given by the reviewer

FIELD.NAME: grade
FIELD.COMMENT: Percentual grade 0..100 for this number of negative responses

TABLE.NAME: workshop_forms_rubric
TABLE.COMMENT: The assessment dimensions definitions of Rubric grading strategy forms

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: The description of the dimension

FIELD.NAME: descriptionformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of the description field

TABLE.NAME: workshop_forms_rubric_levels
TABLE.COMMENT: The definition of rubric rating scales

FIELD.NAME: dimensionid
FIELD.COMMENT: Which criterion this level is part of

FIELD.NAME: grade
FIELD.COMMENT: Grade representing this level.

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: The definition of this level

FIELD.NAME: descriptionformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of the description field
